pym.cli module¶

class pym.cli.Cli¶

Bases: builtins.object

static add_parser_args(parser, which=None)¶

Adds default arguments to given parser instance.

Parameters:
  • parser – Instance of a parser
  • which – List of 2-Tuples. 1st elem tells which argument to add, 2nd elem tells requiredness True/False
impersonate_root()¶
impersonate_unit_tester()¶
init_app(args, lgg=None, rc=None, rc_key=None, setup_logging=True)¶

Initialises Pyramid application.

Loads config settings. Initialises SQLAlchemy and a session.

Parameters:
  • args – Namespace of parsed CLI arguments
  • lgg – Inject a logger, or keep the default module logger
  • rc – Inject a RC instance, or keep the loaded one.
  • rc_key – obsolete
  • setup_logging – Whether or not to setup logging as configured in rc. Default is True.
init_web_app(args, lgg=None, rc=None, rc_key=None, setup_logging=True)¶

Initialises the full web application.

Calls init_app() and additionally initialises the WSGI environment and sets up a request and the resource tree.

sess¶

Initialised DB session.

The session is created from the web app’s default settings and therefore is in most cases a scoped session with transaction extension. If you need a different session, caller may create one itself and set this property.
